text: Ingrid Lynn Moll (born April 17, 1973) is a Judge of the Connecticut Appellate Court. == Education == Moll earned her Bachelor of Arts in Political Science and French in 1995 and her Juris Doctor from the University of Connecticut School of Law in 1999. == Early legal career == Moll has worked at Motley Rice, LLC, McCarter & English, LLP, and Cummings & Lockwood, LLC. Moll has been recognized for excellence in environmental litigation. == Superior Court service == She was appointed to the Superior Court by Governor Dan Malloy in 2014. == Appointment to state appellate court == She was nominated to the Connecticut Appellate Court by Governor Dan Malloy on May 3, 2018. Her current term expires in 2026. == References == == External links == * Official Biography on State of Connecticut Judicial Branch website * Category:1973 births Category:Living people Category:20th-century American lawyers Category:21st-century American lawyers Category:21st-century American judges Category:Judges of the Connecticut Appellate Court Category:Wheaton College (Massachusetts) alumni Category:Superior court judges in the United States Category:University of Connecticut faculty Category:University of Connecticut School of Law alumni
title: Ingrid L. Moll
